come out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if something comes out, it is removed from a place
come out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: These stains will never come out!
come out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if information comes out, people learn about it, especially after it has been kept secret
come out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: No doubt the truth will come out one day.
It’s come out that several ministers received payments from the company.
come out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a photograph comes out, it shows a clear picture
come out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: I took some photographs, but they didn’t come out.
The wedding photos have come out really well.
come out.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if a book, record etc comes out, it becomes publicly available
come out.translation[0].definitions[3].e: When is the new edition coming out?
come out.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if something comes out in a particular way, that is what it is like after it has been made or produced
come out.translation[0].definitions[4].e: I’ve made a cake, but it hasn’t come out very well.
The cover has come out a bit too big.
come out.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if something you say comes out in a particular way, that is how it sounds or how it is understood
come out.translation[0].definitions[5].e: His words came out as little more than a whisper.
That didn’t come out the way I meant it to.
I tried to explain everything to her, but it came out all wrong (=not in the way I intended).
come out.translation[0].definitions[6].d: if someone comes out in a particular way, that is the situation they are in at the end of an event or series of events
come out.translation[0].definitions[6].e: The more experienced team came out on top.
She came out of the divorce quite well.
come out.translation[0].definitions[7].e: His right-wing opinions come out quite strongly in his later writings.
come out.translation[0].definitions[8].d: to say publicly that you strongly support or oppose a plan, belief etc
come out.translation[0].definitions[8].e: At least he’s got the courage to come out and say what he thinks.
The board of directors has come out in favour of a merger.
Teachers have come out against the proposed changes.
come out.translation[0].definitions[9].d: if the sun, moon, or stars come out, they appear in the sky
come out.translation[0].definitions[9].e: The sky cleared and the sun came out.
if a flower comes out, it opens
The snowdrops were just starting to come out.
if someone comes out, they say that they are gay when this was a secret before
That summer, I decided to come out to my parents.
to refuse to work, as a protest
Nurses have threatened to come out in support of their pay claim.
We decided to come out on strike.
if a young woman came out in the past, she was formally introduced into upper-class society at a large formal dance
